rComments: Prof. Wang is awesome. I'm always amazed by the wealth of knowledge and analysis she incorporates into the lectures post-screenings. I can tell she herself is very invested and excited about the topics and readings (both of which are extremely interesting) we discuss; however, her lecture slides are really verbose, and she tends to go on tangents.

Do not expect her classes to be film classes. They're much more concerned with sociohistorical and cultural discourses, using film as a window into these topics. I'm in class right now and I'll literally quote her next sentence: "western colonial discourse is a discourse that manufactures and depends upon stereotyping the Other". That sums it up

She has a very thick accent and is somewhat difficult to understand. She holds the microphone up to her face and moves her head around a lot so her voice cuts in and out. She doesn't know how to operate electronics and wastes a lot of time. Gives too much info on slides.

The films and readings were interesting but OH GOD those lectures. Two hours of rambling, hard to understand nonsense. Her accent and penchant for big words make it hard to understand her, and the fact that there is near-zero discussion means you'll never have a chance to ask questions and try to grasp the concepts. Also: TERRIBLE essay prompts.

I came into the Gender and Global Cinema class with excitement and interest and left the class with utter disappointment. Wang's lectures can span for 3 hours straight of her talking without taking a breath, making it difficult for even the most attentive of students to pay attention. She doesn't give room for discussion in the class either.

She knows her Chinese cinema, that's for sure. Film selections were great, reading material was always fairly interesting, and her lectures were often informative, though sometimes they could run on a little long. Still, not a class you can slack off in; you need to work for your grade.
rubbish.  teaches a bunch of gobblygook that sorta maybe has something to do with film.  lots of backwards ass retarded film theory stuff.  unclear.  antagonistic towards class.  unnecessary person.
